configuration.mailchimp_subject_line: Intro blurb: A single unified balenaOS image, backup data with Blues Wireless, use Cloud Relay to send data to your preferred cloud provider
configuration.mailchimp_preview_text: Monthly updates on projects, features, and events from balena July 2022

featured.text:
BalenaOS is now (since v2.85) available in a single unified image that can be configured at runtime for development or production mode. We're moving on from maintaining both development and production images to reduce operational overhead as well as giving us a better understanding of how our users would manage an image in production. Instead, you can now access development mode via runtime configuration changes. Learn more.

Also in this months email:
  • Setup Blues Wireless to back up your sensor data
  • Easily send data to your favorite cloud provider
  • How to prototype, deploy and scale robotics solutions

news.title: Setup Blues Wireless to backup sensor data using balena
news.text: In this post, we introduce Blues Wireless, and how to use it as a backup method of connectivity with embedded devices, like Raspberry Pis using a balena Block.

news.title: Introducing the Cloud Relay Block: send data to your favorite cloud provider
news.text: Want to send data from your balena device to a cloud IoT provider like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud? The Cloud Relay Block packages this automation on the device so you only need to send your data to it, while the block manages the rest!

news.title: Using NFS Server to share external storage between containers
news.button_text: Find out how they use balena
news.text: To help with their machine learning use case, customers and community members Theia Scientific and Volkov Labs created the Theiascopeâ„¢ platform put together a NFS server solution to help process large amounts of data with edge devices.

news.title: Prototype, deploy, and scale robotics solutions with balena
news.text: Hardware Hacker Cristian has been hard at work creating new balena blocks, and in this post he walks through how anyone can use these blocks to prototype, deploy, and scale an IoT robot fleet.

projects.text: Find out more about the new blocks which make it trivial to add a Notecard to balena projects, and allows balena users to easily and securely send data over a cellular network.

projects.title: Balena at DockerCon - Scaling to 100k+ devices
projects.text: Last month balena Developer Advocate Marc Pous showcased how containers can enable deployments of 100,000+ IoT devices and that the Raspberry Pi can readily replicate and distribute containers.

projects.title: Partnering with graduate students to explore customer projection models
projects.text: Over the past semester, we've worked with students studying business analytics at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute (RPI) to build customer projections. Find out how it went here.

projects.title: Deploy more easily with Tilt
projects.text: Tilt is a toolkit for fixing the pains of microservice development. In this blog post, a balena community member shows us how Tilt can save you needing to manually rebuild your docker compose file.
